The simplest way is to use a Vex versa planetary gearbox with no reduction. I imagine the Rev planetary could do the same. It is  a little up front cost, but it lets you add reduction if needed and gives good mounting options. It is vary reusable. Not saying the same about the motor which is somewhat Bale","username":"cbale2000","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/cbale2000/{size}/2142_2.png","created_at":"2023-07-27T18:46:23.205Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eTo add to this, my first reaction was to suggest the Rev Ultraplanetary, but \u003ca href=\"https://docs.revrobotics.com/ultraplanetary/ultraplanetary-gearbox/assembly-instructions\"\u003eupon further investigation\u003c/a\u003e it appears to not be compatible with 775-class motors.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eCostwise, the \u003ca href=\"https://www.vexrobotics.com/versaplanetary-lite.html\"\u003eVex VP Lite gearbox\u003c/a\u003e with \u003ca href=\"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-3564.html\"\u003e775 mounting plates\u003c/a\u003e and extra \u003ca href=\"https://www.vexrobotics.com/217-2897.html\"\u003e1/2\" Hex Output\u003c/a\u003e (note, you need a pair of snap-ring pliers to replace the default 3/8\" hex shaft) is probably the best option ($37.97 before tax/shipping). If you need gear reductions, they can be added relatively inexpensively (~$25 per reduction stage).\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003e\u003cem\u003eOn a related note, is it just me or did Vex stop selling their “Lite” ring gears?
